title: Centaur
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

*This page is about the obsolete player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Centaur (monster)](/Centaur_\(monster\) "Centaur (monster)"). For a list of all monstrous centaurs, see [List of centaurs](/List_of_centaurs "List of centaurs").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The Centaurs are another species of hybrid creatures: horses with Human torsos. They usually live in forests, surviving by hunting.Centaurs can move very quickly on their four legs, and are excellent with bows and other missile weapons; they are also reasonable at fighting in general while being slow learners at specific weapon skills. They advance quite slowly in experience levels and are rather sub-par at using magic. Like Nagas, they receive reduced protection from the body armour they wear. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [8 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- Centaurs are hybrids, half-horse and half-man:

  - **[Deformed](/Deformed "Deformed")**: Centaurs only gain half the base AC from [body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour").
  - Centaurs get an [EV](/EV "EV") and [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") penalty, due to their size.
  - Centaurs can equip [centaur bardings](/Centaur_barding "Centaur barding"), but not [boots](/Boots "Boots").
  - Centaurs are large enough to attack normally while standing in [shallow water](/Shallow_water "Shallow water") (though they still move slowly through it).
  - Centaurs require less skill to use [shields](/Shields "Shields") effectively than other [medium-sized](/Size#medium "Size") races.

- **[Tough Skin](/Tough_Skin "Tough Skin") 3**: Centaurs have extremely tough skin (AC +3).

- **[Hooves](/Hooves "Hooves") 3**: Centaurs have a kick [auxiliary attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"). Hooves reduce [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") by -20 if you aren't [flying](/Flying "Flying").

- **[Fast](/Fast "Fast") 2**: Centaurs cover ground very quickly during [movement](/Movement "Movement"). (0.7 [decaAut](/DecaAut "DecaAut") per tile, equal to 14.2 monster "speed"; slightly slower than [monster centaurs](/Centaur_\(monster\) "Centaur (monster)")).

Centaurs have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 10, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 7 and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 4 (before [background](/Background "Background") modifiers).

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter"), [Gladiator](/Gladiator "Gladiator"), [Hunter](/Hunter "Hunter")
- **Warrior-mages:** [Warper](/Warper "Warper"), [Arcane Marksman](/Arcane_Marksman "Arcane Marksman")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [strength](/Strength "Strength") or [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") (equal chance) every 4th level.
- 10% more [HP](/HP "HP") than average.
- 10% less [MP](/MP "MP") than average.
- +3 [magic resistance](/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") per level.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Centaurs start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species") • **[Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species")** • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Due to having high [HP](/HP "HP") and fast [move speed](/Move_speed "Move speed"), Centaurs are a very forgiving species. Speed allows Centaurs to [kite](/Kite "Kite") most targets, disengage from many bad fights, reposition favorably, and avoid being surrounded. High HP, especially when compared to the other fast species ([Spriggans](/Spriggan "Spriggan") and [Felids](/Felid "Felid")), means that you're less likely to die from [orc priests](/Orc_priest "Orc priest") and the like. They have an amazing [Bows](/Bows_\(skill\) "Bows (skill)") aptitude, but any sort of ranged attack can work well too.

Centaurs are not without their problems (poor defensive aptitudes, low stealth, [Deformed](/Deformed "Deformed") mutation), but the benefits far outweigh the cons. The innate +3 AC from [Tough Skin](/Tough_Skin "Tough Skin") counteracts Deformed; Centaurs only get a net AC loss when wearing heavier armours. Plus, they can wear [centaur bardings](/Centaur_barding "Centaur barding"), which give more AC than boots - assuming you find one.

They are considered "Intermediate" because it's considered difficult for a completely new player to understand *Crawl'*s [speed system](/Action "Action") (and take advantage of kiting) from scratch. It's not because they are weak; Centaurs are one of the strongest species overall, arguably easier than "Simple" species like [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") and [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul").

## Skill aptitudes

Values are from the most recent version that had both the species and the skill:

|                [Skill](/Skill "Skill")               | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :--------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                     ***Attack***                     |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|           [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")           |                 0                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                               -3 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                               -3 |
|     [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")     |                -1                |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                               -3 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                               -1 |
|       [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")      |                -1                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                               -4 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                               -1 |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") |                -1                | [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)") |                               -3 | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                         |                               -1 |
|                 [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                 |                -1                |         [Stabbing](/Stabbing "Stabbing")        |                               -3 | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                               -1 |
|           [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")           |                -1                |             [Traps](/Traps "Traps")             |                               -2 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                               -1 |
|       [Staves](/Magical_staff "Magical staff")       |                -1                |                                                 |                                  | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                               -1 |
|  [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat")  |                 0                |    [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")    |                                1 | [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") |                               -1 |
|                                                      |                                  |      [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")     |                               -1 |                                                    |                                  |
|           [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")           |                 1                | [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") |                              N/A | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                               -1 |
|  [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")  |                N/A               |                                                 |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                               -1 |
|              [Slings](/Slings "Slings")              |                 1                |      [Experience](/Experience "Experience")     |                               -1 | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                               -1 |
|                 [Bows](/Bows "Bows")                 |                 3                |                                                 |                                  | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                               -1 |
|          [Crossbows](/Crossbows "Crossbows")         |                 1                |                                                 |                                  | [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic")       |                               -2 |
|                                                      |                                  |                                                 |                                  | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                      |                              N/A |

## Trivia

[Centaurs](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centaur) are originally creatures from Greek mythology.

## History

- Playable centaurs were removed in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26").
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), centaurs were [Herbivorous](/Herbivorous "Herbivorous"), gaining more nutrition from vegetarian foods and less from meat-based foods. They also had [Fast Metabolism](/Fast_Metabolism "Fast Metabolism") 1, causing them to [hunger](/Hunger "Hunger") more quickly. As a result, they started with one more [bread ration](/Bread_ration "Bread ration") than most species.

| [Species](/Species "Species") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Simple                        | [Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf") • [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") • [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") • [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") • [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") • [Troll](/Troll "Troll") • [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") • [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") • [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") |
| Intermediate                  | [Human](/Human "Human") • [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold") • [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") • [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") • [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan") • [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul") • [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu") • [Oni](/Oni "Oni") • [Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi")                                                    |
| Advanced                      | [Coglin](/Coglin "Coglin") • [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") • [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") • [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod") • [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") • [Naga](/Naga "Naga") • [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode") • [Felid](/Felid "Felid") • [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy")                               |
html:
Centaur

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

This page is about the obsolete player species. For the monster, see Centaur (monster). For a list of all monstrous centaurs, see List of centaurs.

The Centaurs are another species of hybrid creatures: horses with Human torsos. They usually live in forests, surviving by hunting.

Centaurs can move very quickly on their four legs, and are excellent with bows and other missile weapons; they are also reasonable at fighting in general while being slow learners at specific weapon skills. They advance quite slowly in experience levels and are rather sub-par at using magic. Like Nagas, they receive reduced protection from the body armour they wear.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skills and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 Trivia
  • 8 History

Innate Abilities

  • Centaurs are hybrids, half-horse and half-man:
    • Deformed: Centaurs only gain half the base AC from body armour.
    • Centaurs get an EV and Dodging penalty, due to their size.
    • Centaurs can equip centaur bardings, but not boots.
    • Centaurs are large enough to attack normally while standing in shallow water (though they still move slowly through it).
    • Centaurs require less skill to use shields effectively than other medium-sized races.
  • Tough Skin 3: Centaurs have extremely tough skin (AC +3).
  • Hooves 3: Centaurs have a kick auxiliary attack. Hooves reduce stealth by -20 if you aren't flying.
  • Fast 2: Centaurs cover ground very quickly during movement. (0.7 decaAut per tile, equal to 14.2 monster "speed"; slightly slower than monster centaurs).

Centaurs have a base Strength of 10, Intelligence of 7 and Dexterity of 4 (before background modifiers).

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Fighter, Gladiator, Hunter
  • Warrior-mages: Warper, Arcane Marksman

Level Bonuses

  • +1 strength or dexterity (equal chance) every 4th level.
  • 10% more HP than average.
  • 10% less MP than average.
  • +3 magic resistance per level.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Centaurs start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Due to having high HP and fast move speed, Centaurs are a very forgiving species. Speed allows Centaurs to kite most targets, disengage from many bad fights, reposition favorably, and avoid being surrounded. High HP, especially when compared to the other fast species (Spriggans and Felids), means that you're less likely to die from orc priests and the like. They have an amazing Bows aptitude, but any sort of ranged attack can work well too.

Centaurs are not without their problems (poor defensive aptitudes, low stealth, Deformed mutation), but the benefits far outweigh the cons. The innate +3 AC from Tough Skin counteracts Deformed; Centaurs only get a net AC loss when wearing heavier armours. Plus, they can wear centaur bardings, which give more AC than boots - assuming you find one.

They are considered "Intermediate" because it's considered difficult for a completely new player to understand Crawl's speed system (and take advantage of kiting) from scratch. It's not because they are weak; Centaurs are one of the strongest species overall, arguably easier than "Simple" species like Draconian and Ghoul.

Skill aptitudes

Values are from the most recent version that had both the species and the skill:

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 0 Armour -3 Spellcasting -3
Short Blades -1 Dodging -3 Conjurations -1
Long Blades -1 Stealth -4 Hexes -1
Maces & Flails -1 Shields -3 Charms -1
Axes -1 Stabbing -3 Summonings -1
Polearms -1 Traps -2 Necromancy -1
Staves -1 Translocations -1
Unarmed Combat 0 Invocations 1 Transmutations -1
Evocations -1
Throwing 1 Shapeshifting N/A Fire Magic -1
Ranged Weapons N/A Ice Magic -1
Slings 1 Experience -1 Air Magic -1
Bows 3 Earth Magic -1
Crossbows 1 Poison Magic -2
Alchemy N/A

Trivia

Centaurs are originally creatures from Greek mythology.

History

  • Playable centaurs were removed in 0.26.
  • Prior to 0.15, centaurs were Herbivorous, gaining more nutrition from vegetarian foods and less from meat-based foods. They also had Fast Metabolism 1, causing them to hunger more quickly. As a result, they started with one more bread ration than most species.
Species
Simple Mountain Dwarf • Minotaur • Merfolk • Gargoyle • Draconian • Troll • Deep Elf • Armataur • Gnoll
Intermediate Human • Kobold • Demonspawn • Djinni • Spriggan • Ghoul • Tengu • Oni • Barachi
Advanced Coglin • Vine Stalker • Vampire • Demigod • Formicid • Naga • Octopode • Felid • Mummy

{{obsolete}}
''This page is about the obsolete player [[species]]. For the monster, see [[Centaur (monster)]]. For a list of all monstrous centaurs, see [[List of centaurs]].''
{{flavour|The Centaurs are another species of hybrid creatures: horses with Human torsos. They usually live in forests, surviving by hunting.

Centaurs can move very quickly on their four legs, and are excellent with bows and other missile weapons; they are also reasonable at fighting in general while being slow learners at specific weapon skills. They advance quite slowly in experience levels and are rather sub-par at using magic. Like Nagas, they receive reduced protection from the body armour they wear.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*Centaurs are hybrids, half-horse and half-man:
**'''[[Deformed]]''': Centaurs only gain half the base AC from [[body armour]].
**Centaurs get an [[EV]] and [[Dodging]] penalty, due to their size.
**Centaurs can equip [[centaur barding]]s, but not [[boots]].
**Centaurs are large enough to attack normally while standing in [[shallow water]] (though they still move slowly through it).
**Centaurs require less skill to use [[shields]] effectively than other [[Size#medium|medium-sized]] races.
*'''[[Tough Skin]] 3''': Centaurs have extremely tough skin (AC +3).
*'''[[Hooves]] 3''': Centaurs have a kick [[auxiliary attack]]. Hooves reduce [[stealth]] by -20 if you aren't [[flying]].
*'''[[Fast]] 2''': Centaurs cover ground very quickly during [[movement]]. (0.7 [[decaAut]] per tile, equal to 14.2 monster "speed"; slightly slower than [[centaur (monster)|monster centaurs]]).

Centaurs have a base [[Strength]] of 10, [[Intelligence]] of 7 and [[Dexterity]] of 4 (before [[background]] modifiers).

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Warriors:''' [[Fighter]], [[Gladiator]], [[Hunter]]
*'''Warrior-mages:''' [[Warper]], [[Arcane Marksman]]

==Level Bonuses==
*+1 [[strength]] or [[dexterity]] (equal chance) every 4th level.
*10% more [[HP]] than average.
*10% less [[MP]] than average.
*+3 [[magic resistance]] per level.

==Starting Skills and Equipment==
Centaurs start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

==Difficulty of Play==
{{Moderate}}

Due to having high [[HP]] and fast [[move speed]], Centaurs are a very forgiving species. Speed allows Centaurs to [[kite]] most targets, disengage from many bad fights, reposition favorably, and avoid being surrounded. High HP, especially when compared to the other fast species ([[Spriggan]]s and [[Felid]]s), means that you're less likely to die from [[orc priest]]s and the like. They have an amazing [[Bows (skill)|Bows]] aptitude, but any sort of ranged attack can work well too.

Centaurs are not without their problems (poor defensive aptitudes, low stealth, [[Deformed]] mutation), but the benefits far outweigh the cons. The innate +3 AC from [[Tough Skin]] counteracts Deformed; Centaurs only get a net AC loss when wearing heavier armours. Plus, they can wear [[centaur barding]]s, which give more AC than boots - assuming you find one.

They are considered "Intermediate" because it's considered difficult for a completely new player to understand ''Crawl'''s [[action|speed system]] (and take advantage of kiting) from scratch. It's not because they are weak; Centaurs are one of the strongest species overall, arguably easier than "Simple" species like [[Draconian]] and [[Ghoul]].

{{obsolete_species_aptitudes|Centaur}}

==Trivia==
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centaur Centaurs] are originally creatures from Greek mythology. 

==History==
*Playable centaurs were removed in [[0.26]].
*Prior to [[0.15]], centaurs were [[Herbivorous]], gaining more nutrition from vegetarian foods and less from meat-based foods. They also had [[Fast Metabolism]] 1, causing them to [[hunger]] more quickly. As a result, they started with one more [[bread ration]] than most species.
